attributes.action: Reform the police complaints system
attributes.background: For over 50 years, the system has failed to protect Black/Asian people from feeling targeted and racially profiled by the police. We need a new body to investigate police misuse of powers, recommend that individual officers be prosecuted or sacked and recommend ways to reform the police.
attributes.additional_details:
This new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints itself, including being able to call witnesses and summon documents and records. Most importantly, it must include representatives of victims of police misconduct to ensure it has the confidence of every individual in society. People should be protected regardless of colour or background.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/207561
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/166709

attributes.action: Stop private parking companies from imposing fines after you leave the premises.
attributes.background: Parliament should legislate to stop Private Parking Companies from imposing penalty charges after a vehicle has left the location where enforcement is in place.
attributes.additional_details:
Private parking companies should only be able to impose a charge on the spot or must install barriers at entry and exit points to accept payment.
 
Issuing notices by post should be prohibited. 
 
It is a simple solution to a very controversial industry.

attributes.action: Replace the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation
attributes.background: I believe that the ombudsman service just has not got the ability to handle complaints about financial services. There is evidence in the media and on online review services like trustpilot.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to consider replacing the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation that is not funded by, or affiliated with, the banks and other financial services.

attributes.action: Condemn killings by the Indian government
attributes.background: On 23rd May 2018, Indian and local Tamil Nadu government forces killed 13 unarmed civilians protesting against environmental disaster created by Sterlite copper in Tuticorin, TN owned by Vedanta resources plc.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must condemn this human rights violation and urge the India Government to protect human rights, including people’s right to protest.

attributes.action: Allow Left turns on red like in the USA
attributes.background: So in the USA you can legally turn Right on a red light which helps with easing traffic and lowering co2 emmisons So I think that when applicable We should be allowed to turn left on red due to us driving on the left side of the road. This would greatly decrease co2 emmisons and traffic in cities.

attributes.action: Establish an Atrocities Prevention Board.
attributes.background: Human rights and the prevention of mass atrocities should be at the centre of our foreign policy thinking. An Atrocities Prevention Board, made up of representatives from across government, would ensure a comprehensive approach to identify and address threats to vulnerable groups of people.
attributes.additional_details:
Barack Obama established an Atrocities Prevention Board (ABP) in 2012. It has improved the US government's ability to identify early threats and widened the tools with which those threats can be dealt with. It has also provided the impetus to take early action in a number of countries that might otherwise not have received such attention.

A UK equivalent could spur on a similar change and ensure that genocide and mass atrocity prevention are a priority at the highest levels of government.

attributes.action: Ban the selling and open displaying of Golliwog dolls in UK stores.
attributes.background: Golliwog dolls depict a racially insulting charactater of black people. This is no longer acceptable. Sign the petition and let the goverment know, how the UK really feels about the legal selling and displaying of Golliwog dolls.
attributes.additional_details:
The Golliwog character has long been used in childrens literature, to denigrate black people. The use of the racial word "wog" originates from this ignorant depiction of black people.

It's time for all people to make clear that the selling of these racially provocative dolls, needs to stop.

The displaying of such dolls on store front windows, has to stop.

Share and sign this petition.

attributes.action: Lower the cost of taking the Practical driving test.
attributes.background: Every year roughly 850,000 driving tests are conducted but only 47-50% pass. That means one in two tests taken leads to a fail. Although the tests are getting harder, the price of it still remains incredibly high at £62.00. Driving should be a fun and educational life skill not a burden.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Roughly 850,000 driving tests are taken every year in the UK.
2. Only 47-50% pass the test.
3. Tests are getting harder but price is still sky high at £62.00.
4. If you are using your instructors vehicle the cost may increase even more.

attributes.action: Institute a Personage & Citizenry Act
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call on parliament to institute a new act that grants automatic citizenship to any persons that can demonstrate that they have lived continuously in this country for 15 or more years. Subject to having not committed a serious criminal offence
attributes.additional_details:
This act would help secure the rights of people affected by the windrush scandal as well as those people who have migrated here that may be subject to the same treatment in the future.

Personage should be granted to those who are working here to act as a temporary status of citizenry for 5 years. If they continue to hold employment for that time then at the end of the 5 years they are granted full citizenry.

attributes.action: Investigate the role of the Information Commission due to its ineffectiveness
attributes.background: Call for an investigation into the role of the ICO and why they refer the public back to, and do not act against, the public bodies/organisations who do not reply to data requests and maintain their silence in order to block/obstruct complaints. Urgent changes/reforms to the law need to be made
attributes.additional_details: Due to the advice by the petitions committee when rejecting 3 petitions - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/206379 - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/205268 - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/213769 we call on the government/Secretary of State to make appropriate provision to ensure that the Information Commission act to assist members of the public to obtain full disclosure of their records in order to pursue complaints further & ban public bodies from withholding records

attributes.action: Vehicle tax to include levy for repair of roads maintained by local authorities
attributes.background: The condition of local roads is poor.  Pot holes and bad repairs are a mounting problem that impact all road users.  The situation in places can be dangerous and cause significant costs.  A link to vehicle tax would be a link to the number of vehicles and thus provide proportionate funds.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence can be found in the budget of local authorities.  Requirements exceed funding, over many years, by large amounts.

attributes.action: Fund “Off The Street, Less Heat” youth project and similar projects
attributes.background: Off the Street, Less Heat is a youth diversion project which provides sports and other workshops to distract young people from anti-social behaviour, gang-related violence and street crime. Due to Government cuts, it and projects like it have lost funding.
attributes.additional_details: Off the Street, Less Heat was started in 2006/07 by Elaine Roberts, who came up with the name and idea, to help get young people off the streets and welcome people from all different communities. The project also aims to improve the relations between the police and the local community. Off the Street, Less Heat and similar projects all over the country need direct funding from the Government to ensure that they can continue.

attributes.action: Stop Public Health England's recent 'Healthy Eating' initiatives.
attributes.background: PHE have launched several initiatives to make people more 'calorie-aware'. This includes Change4Life's 'look for 100-calorie snacks, two a day max' and the One You Campaign, which advises adults to follow a 400-600-600 diet. Calorie Counting leads to a fixation on numbers and disordered eating.
attributes.additional_details: Anorexia has the highest mortality rate of any psychiatric disorder, with at least 20% of Anorexia sufferers dying prematurely. (Source: BEAT Eating Disorders). Full recovery from this illness involves moving away from all preoccupation with food. Therefore, calorie counting is incompatible with recovery and may lead to a rise in eating disorders. Please support me to ensure more people are protected from this life-ruining condition.

attributes.action: Give free child care to all 2 year olds
attributes.background: Why should only parents on certain benefits receive childcare? For fairness, all 2 year olds should receive free childcare, regardless of background.

attributes.action: Increase the expenditure of money on prisons.
attributes.background: The prison system hasn't been correctly funded or managed for years. We propose that the government spends more of its expenditure on the prison system to increase capacity and pursue its purpose.

attributes.action: Urge the international community to bring Bashar al Assad to justice.
attributes.background:
Since the start of the Syrian Civil War in 2011, hundreds of thousands of civilians have been murdered in Syria, with the vast majority of deaths being attributed to Assad and his forces.

The international community must do more to bring Assad to justice.
attributes.additional_details:
Assad has invalidated his sovereignty over Syria. Hundreds of thousands of his own people have been murdered and tortured. Intervention is justified and necessary both morally and politically on the basis of these grave human rights violations. 

http://sn4hr.org

http://www.syriahr.com/en/

attributes.action: Inquiry on collapse of Monarch & the safeguarding of pensions
attributes.background: There have been calls for a public inquiry to the collapse of Monarch airlines and maybe look into changing the law on pensions so when a company goes into administration money can be put aside for the pension fund.
attributes.additional_details: The Chair of Parliament’s Work and Pensions Committee expressed concern over claims that private equity group Greybull Capital could avoid losing money while the carrier’s pension fund – which is owed £7.5m – could be among creditors left with nothing.

attributes.action: Provide more support to put an end to modern slavery in Libya
attributes.background: Last year CNN released video footage of Black African migrants being bought and sold in to slavery in Libya. The horrific events happened openly in slave auctions and migrants were being sold for as little as $400. There were also many accounts that women and girls were being sold in to sex slavery.
attributes.additional_details:
It has now been almost a year since the release of the slave auction video footage. The media's interest has significantly lessened, and public discussion has waned.

I am therefore asking the UK government to again put pressure on Libya to put an end to modern-day slavery. I am also asking the UK government to provide the public with a full and transparent update on the UK emergency interventions and UK programmes designed to specifically target Black African migrants and refugees in Libya, including a response containing details of further plans to support the complete eradication of modern slavery in the region.

https://edition.cnn.com/2017/11/14/africa/libya-migrant-auctions/index.html

attributes.action: Create an ombudsman for the travel industry
attributes.background: At the moment when a person has a complaint regarding the travel industry the only person they can complain to is the travel member or ABTA. If there was an ombudsman appointed then the customer would stand a better chance of being helped by someone who is independent.

attributes.action: Scrap the CQC as an onerous bombastic regulation lead organisation
attributes.background: The CQC and its predecessors have developed this watch dog role since 2004, and it’s worth asking what if anything, these state appointed monitors have contributed to health and social care during that time, apart from undermining leadership and interrupting health care delivery.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the CQC have made clear mistakes over recent years. It is clear that they are unlikely to change their methodology and a majority of health care professionals across the country think they are not fit for purpose, and wish to see a change in the way health and social care is regulated.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all Police Officers to carry Taser by 2020
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for all Police Officers to carry a Taser gun by 2020 to protect Police Officers and the public.

attributes.action: Anti depressants should be free to everyone who suffers depression.
attributes.background: I’m calling for this to be reviewed, contraception is free on the NHS, but a person with a mental disability (depression) is to be charged for having what can’t be prevented. For people who work, prescriptions are chargeable, assuming people can afford it. This is not the case.

attributes.action: Make a mandatory minimum sentence for child sex offenders
attributes.background:
To many sex offenders get let of with community punishment orders ect I think there should be more of a deterrent and a mandatory minimum prison sentence. 
Also the public especially those with children should have acces to view if any registered sex offenders live in the area they reside.

attributes.action: Stop Cat D (open prisons) holding sex offenders within 5 miles of any school.
attributes.background: Safety for all our children. An open prison means prisoners can leave prison unescorted. Being near any school I feel this is asking for trouble and very dangerous.

attributes.action: Help fund the NHS so people can have (Otoplasty-Pinnaplasty) surgery.
attributes.background:
I would like to have cosmetic surgery as my ears stick out a bit,  I’ve been to my doctors and seen different doctors and they said I might not be accepted due to funding and not have a good case.

I suffer from Body Dysmorphic Disorder and severe depression, having  ears pinned would help a bit.
attributes.additional_details:
People who need and would like to have Otoplasty surgery can’t get it done due to NHS not funded enough. It costs too much going private and either myself and/or other people who want Otoplasty can’t afford it. It’s not right that myself or others would have to go private. The cost is about £2,500-£3,500 plus any consultations etc.

I want to get this done as it’s causimg me significant Psychological distress and others feel the same. I don’t want to go privately to get cosmetic surgery.

attributes.action: Impose a 3 to 5% sales tax for online every day retail purchases- exc food, hols
attributes.background: Town centres are the beating heart of the community in Britain. As well as the environmental impact of ordering everything online, trying it on, sending it back etc big dominant US retailers take money out of the UK with unfair tax dodges. Let's boost the high street, or chancery coffers, with e-VAT

attributes.action: Ban the sale of all acid that burns the skin on contact
attributes.background: Today I walked into a discount home store and found acid on sale for £1.99. Thousands of lives destroyed for only £1.99.
attributes.additional_details: As a plumber I have used acid before and find it is dangerous even for me to use, even when standing back from it and reaching out to pour it down the drain it can still burn my eyes and face from the fumes. As a result I do not use it for cleaning drains, acid destroys the plug hole and all seals on the pipes. There is no need for it to be used for plumbing. Acids are used in a lot of items from lemons to drain cleaner, however some are diluted and would not cause harm, so i am asking for all acids that burn the skin instantly to be banned outright.

attributes.action: Require companies to tell applicants the status of their job application.
attributes.background: Applicants should have a right to receive a reply from employers. This petition isn’t to push for critical feedback, but a simple “yes, you have a job” or “no, you haven’t." Failure to reply within a reasonable time-frame should be punished by fines, depending on the company's size.
attributes.additional_details:
A simple reply from an employer can help better a person's options. People seeking work explore and apply for various types of employment, unskilled jobs, career and training programs or apprenticeships; and often, many of these jobs would start around the same time. Some options may be better than others depending on the individual, and a simple reply of “yes”, “no” or “still being reviewed” can improve a person on making a better choice financially or for their lifestyle.

Placing an applicant in a state of suspense and stress, sometimes for months when it comes to programs and apprenticeships is a cruel situation to place anyone in, when a feedback about the application will allow an applicant to move on and accept other options.

attributes.action: Urge newly elected PM Imran Khan to stop persecution of Ahmadi Muslims
attributes.background: All over the world a small sect of Muslims known as the Ahmadiyya Muslim Community are persecuted and oppressed. Perhaps no other place do Ahmadis face worse persecution than in Pakistan.
attributes.additional_details:
In Pakistan oppressive laws mean Ahmadis often live in fear and are denied basic rights. Ahamadis cannot vote, their mosques are often targeted, for example, in 2010 where 86 Ahmadi worshippers were killed during Friday prayers and they can face up to 3 years in jail for calling themselves Muslims. 

Pakistan has just elected a new PM. PM Khan says that he want an just and equal society. There is now a golden opportunity for the UK Government to pressure Khan to address the persecution of Ahmadis.

attributes.action: Provide Network Rail with funding for the second entrance at Putney Station
attributes.background:
Wandsworth Council have been pushing for a 2nd entrance to Putney Station for years, but have failed to secure funding.

This project would improve access between SWT and District Line and reduce congestion in the main entrance. Please back this project with government funding.
attributes.additional_details:
Wandsworth Council article showing the benefits to locals:
http://www.wandsworth.gov.uk/news/article/13181/rail_passengers_urged_to_quiz_rail_chiefs_on_new_station_entrance

Local Guardian article about the plans:
http://www.yourlocalguardian.co.uk/news/10636235.Train_bosses_urged_to_consider_second_entrance_plan_for_Putney_station/

Putney High Street is also one of the most polluted roads in London, so this project would have health benefits, as well as saving time for passengers.

attributes.action: To make the M5 north and south bond to 4/5 lanes wide from Exeter to Bristol.
attributes.background: The M5 north and south bond is one of the most congested motorways in the country and each week thousands of people are stuck in heavy traffic jams turning1 hour trips into 4 hours of stand still traffic. Extending each side to 4 or 5 lanes would increase the flow of traffic and decrease congestion.

attributes.action: Change ‘national speed limit’ signs so they show the actual speed for that road
attributes.background: The current National speed limit signs are confusing for most drivers on our roads. If the signs were to display an actual speed limit for any given road this would take away any uncertainty.

attributes.action: Legislate to allow for ‘no questions asked’ divorces in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: We the undersigned call on the Government to amend current divorce legislation to allow for a ‘no questions asked’ divorce granted 28 days after the acceptance of the decree nisi. The decree absolute being granted on the 29th day.

attributes.action: Provide a minimum of 100 litres of clean water per person daily, free of charge
attributes.background:
Water supply is fast becoming one of the most expensive utilities.
I believe every UK citizen should be entitled to a minimum amount, supplied free of charge by all regional water companies, enough to provide the basic human needs and maintain health and hygiene at a good standard.
attributes.additional_details:
Water is now an expensive commodity.
There is no option of choice of supplier in the water supply industry for private households.
Water is a life essential and any modern country should be required to provide a minimum amount free of charge to maintain health in the population.

attributes.action: Give cadet forces more funding + get all air cadets squadrons back in the sky.
attributes.background: Cadet funding is low, especially in areas such as the Thongsbridge detachment, as their cadet building is more of a mobile home than a building. Furthermore, more than half of the air cadet forces have had their volountier glider squadrons disbanded, meaning these air cadets can no longer fly planes
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/03/19/air-cadet-cuts-will-see-more-than-half-of-squadrons-axed/ - air cadets grounded evidence

https://armycadets.com/about-us/acf-structure/the-acfa/about-acfa/acfa-funding/ - Cadets are currently charity funded

https://www.sea-cadets.org/how-were-funded - sea cadets are funded by the individual cadets and fundraising

More cadet funding will help improve the cadet forces, teaching young people great skills and getting more kids off the streets.

attributes.action: Ban smoking within 6 meters from public entrances; exempting pubs and clubs.
attributes.background: As an extension to the Health Act of 2006, extending the ban around public entrances further benefits non-smokers, while not providing additional hardships on smokers.  This benefits ground level offices mostly as smokers usually do so just outside, causing smoke to drift into nearby windows.
attributes.additional_details: In the strictest sense, no law regarding entrance proximity contravenes the Health Act as these environments are no longer smoke free.  While one cannot control wind direction and the like, distance away from these entrances would normally include distance from windows, as well as provide a better environment for visitors.  This ensures the well being and comfort of non-smokers indoors remains intact, and only requires smokers to travel a few additional steps.

attributes.action: Make fire extinguishers mandatory in tower blocks
attributes.background: Many tower blocks don’t have the minimum safety in case a fire occurs and to prevent any further accident to spread, there should be a law forcing tower blocks to have fire extinguishers

attributes.action: Make Jordan Pickford’s birthday (March 7th) a national holiday
attributes.background: Jordan Pickford has been England’s Number 1 goalkeeper at the 2018 World Cup and he has been brilliant. Jordan Pickford’s birthday should be a national holiday to celebrate his performances at the 2018 World Cup.

attributes.action: Government funding for free public transport for stage 4 cancer patients.
attributes.background:
There should be free public transport for people under pension age who have stage 4 cancer, or similarly life-shortening illnesses.
This entitlement will end at pension age to be replaced by the freedom pass.
attributes.additional_details: Those diagnosed with life-shortening illnesses will not have the opportunity to use free public transport for as long as the rest of the public on average.

attributes.action: Create charter & new body for complaints about Local Authority Chief Executives
attributes.background: We need a new tribunal that would carry out hearings against Chief Executives in local authorities/councils who misuse their powers/cover up complaints/are awarded excessive salaries. The new body should recommend that individuals be prosecuted/sacked & recommend ways to reform the local authority.
attributes.additional_details: This new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints itself, including being able to call Chief Executives/witnesses to appear, summon documents & records. Most importantly, it must include the complainants to ensure it has the confidence of the public. Currently those in our public services are able to misuse public money to defend themselves by using legal departments to cover up whilst the public face cutbacks to services. The public should have the right to challenge

attributes.action: Better Mental Health Services for Autistic Individuals.
attributes.background: Better Mental Health Services are needed for Autistic Individuals. It is important to have the right mental health services for autistic teenagers and adults to help with the stresses and strains of mental health as well as daily life. There are not enough services specific for those with an ASC.

attributes.action: Improve the number and quality of care homes
attributes.background: Many children in care experience multiple placements, in some cases going to 8 or more different care homes. This is because care homes either shut down or get too full, so a large number of children in care have nowhere to go and end up on the streets, increasing child poverty numbers.

attributes.action: Create a medal for those injured or killed whilst in service or on operations
attributes.background: I want the introduction of a medal to be automatically awarded to those members of the UK armed forces, and security and emergency services injured or killed whilst serving in any capacity during the course of their service or whilst on operations

attributes.action: Set up law to exempt spouse and parents of those KIA from council tax for life
attributes.background:
There is no law at present which exempts spouse and parents of those members of the armed forces, security services, NHS and police killed during their service or when on operations. 
To honour them, I want UK legislation to excuse their spouse and parents from council tax liability for life

attributes.action: Increase the annual salary of all public sector workers by 3%.
attributes.background:
We, the people of Britain, would like to request an increase of the annual salary for all public sector workers by 3%. In particular, the pay wage of Police, Firefighters and workers of the NHS. 

We feel that the wages should be increased because of the heroic services they provide everyday.
attributes.additional_details:
"The starting salary for Police Officers in England, Wales and Northern Ireland is between £19,971 and £23,124, rising to £38,382 at the top of the scale - achievable after about seven years.."

"Public Sector workers help you when you need it, no matter how bad of a situation. Some make you feel safe and risk their whole life for us, saving lives. They train and dedicated their life to make sure the people of Britain are safe and secure in the area that they live. They deserve more." - Nameless

attributes.action: Introduce Online Sales Tax to fund NHS spending increase
attributes.background:
The Government has "gifted" the NHS an extra £20bn of our money, proposed through raising yet more tax on middle and higher income earners!

An Online Sales Tax directed against Google, Amazon, eBay, Twitter etc should be used to offset tax rises for stretched families and save our high street.
attributes.additional_details:
Amazon and Google both generated £7bn in sales revenue in 2017.  A new OST of 12% (on top of VAT) would generate £1.8bn per annum alone.  Facebook did £850m in sales, generating another £100m OST for the pot.

Middle and higher income earners are not a limitless well of money for the Government to keep dipping into.  The top 1% of income earners already pay more than 28% of all income tax.  This is unsustainable in the long term and we need to reduce taxes & seek efficiency savings.

attributes.action: Recall of UK ambassador to the US in protest about detaining children in cages.
attributes.background: The United States government has implemented a policy on 06/04/2018 to separate and detain children of asylum seekers entering the US. This is an illegal and inhuman act. By withdrawing (recalling) the UK's ambassador to the US this send a strong an clear message that this is not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
Since June 2018 US Customs and Border Portection have been forcibly removing children from their parents, people claiming asylum. These children have and are being detained in centres little more than cages and tented cities. The children are numbered and tagged. The US government has now opened 'Tender Age Shelters' to house babies and infants. See:

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/rachel-maddow-cries-tender-age-shelters-video-us-migrant-children-separated-parents-a8407436.html

attributes.action: Provide clarity around the powers & legislation of bailiffs & civil enforcement
attributes.background: Civil enforcement agencies and bailiffs are a private entity which are used to recover debt. There have been a large number of cases where these enforcement agents are providing misleading information occupiers at properties which generally leaves no choice but to make payments in full.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to this lack of clarity police are called to such instances around 89% of times, wasting police time as they can not enforce anything except ensure there is no breach in peace as the matter is of a civil nature. 

If warrants had stated thereon the powers of entry a bailiff or enforcement may have according to the type of warrant they are present to execute, this would be beneficial all parties including the police as they generally have no knowledge about the rights of these agents

attributes.action: Change GCSE's Grades From 9-1 to 1-9
attributes.background: Most people get confused with the new GCSE's grading system and personally i do not like it.

attributes.action: Allow all shops (regardless of size) to open for only 6 hours on a Sunday.
attributes.background: The government should allow all shops (regardless of size) to open only for up to any 6 consecutive hours on a Sunday, because Sunday is a special day for families to get together. To protect the high street, the government should also ban home deliveries for online shopping on a Sunday.
attributes.additional_details: The government should allow all shops (regardless of size) to open only for any 6 hours on Sundays and the government should force all shops (regardless of size) to close on Easter Sunday and on Christmas Day when it falls on a Sunday. The only exceptions should be petrol stations that only sell fuel, airport shops (past security), pharmacies and shops on seagoing ships.
